page.title: 12PLANT,ROADS & AIRFIELDS
page.content: Plant,Roads and Airfields is a wing of 18 Support Squadron. It is based at Wainscott and was there before Chattenden Barracks was built.It now is a part of the Chattenden complex. The PR&A as it is called is one of the most important parts of the School of Engineering. It teaches Royal Engineer soldiers of all ranks to operate, manage and maintain plant equipment. It also teaches soldiers from the Infantry and Royal Artillary how to operate the machines that they use. Soldiers are also taught how to interpret ground conditions so that they know whether the ground is suitable to take their machines on and what lies underneath the surface. The first course a soldier attends at the PR&A is the Plant Operator Mechanic 0-2. Before he can go on this course he must first have obtained a
